paragraphs.content: Chapter 28
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 28

paragraphs.content: The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.

paragraphs.content: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding and knowledge the state thereof shall be prolonged.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding and knowledge the state thereof shall be prolonged.

paragraphs.content: A poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.

paragraphs.content: They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.

paragraphs.content: Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the LORD understand all things.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the Lord understand all things.

paragraphs.content: Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.

paragraphs.content: Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous men shameth his father.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous men shameth his father.

paragraphs.content: He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.

paragraphs.content: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer shall be abomination.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer shall be abomination.

paragraphs.content: Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but the upright shall have good things in possession.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but the upright shall have good things in possession.

paragraphs.content: The rich man is wise in his own conceit; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The rich man is wise in his own conceit; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.

paragraphs.content: When righteous men do rejoice, there is great glory: but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When righteous men do rejoice, there is great glory: but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.

paragraphs.content: He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.

paragraphs.content: Happy is the man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Happy is the man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.

paragraphs.content: As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; so is a wicked ruler over the poor people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; so is a wicked ruler over the poor people.

paragraphs.content: The prince that wanteth understanding is also a great oppressor: but he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The prince that wanteth understanding is also a great oppressor: but he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.

paragraphs.content: A man that doeth violence to the blood of any person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man that doeth violence to the blood of any person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.

paragraphs.content: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.

paragraphs.content: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough.

paragraphs.content: A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.

paragraphs.content: To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress.

paragraphs.content: He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.

paragraphs.content: He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.

paragraphs.content: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression; the same is the companion of a destroyer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression; the same is the companion of a destroyer.

paragraphs.content: He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in the LORD shall be made fat.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in the Lord shall be made fat.

paragraphs.content: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.

paragraphs.content: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.

paragraphs.content: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.
